page.title: 05POPE'S MEADOW/PEOPLE'S PARK
page.content: Near the centre of Luton, going north, there is a hill. On one side is a park area called Pope's Meadow, on the other side is People's Park. When Luton had many hat factories in the area these parks were for the workers. Pope's Meadow has trees at the top, where it is very steep and then a meadow where there are football pitches in winter. People go there to play games. People's Park also has a lot of trees at the top, where it is very steep, and also around the edges. It has footpaths and games pitches. It has a children's playground with swings and roundabouts. In winter, Richmond Hill School goes sledging in People's Park. The boys go cross country running in People's Park and around Pope's Meadow. We are lucky having these parks so near the centre of Luton.
